alert.note: Alert for Coahoma; Tunica (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 13 at 5:02PM CDT until April 13 at 5:45PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM CDT FOR EASTERN LEE...CENTRAL PHILLIPS...NORTHWESTERN COAHOMA AND WEST CENTRAL TUNICA COUNTIES... At 502 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Haynes to 6 miles west of Helena-West Helena to 7 miles northeast of Crumrod, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Elaine, Helena-West Helena, St Francis National Park, Friars Point, Sherard, Brickeys, Crumrod, Lake View, Jeffersonville, Rena Lara, Mosby Spur, Ferguson, Wabash, Modoc, Preston Place, Haleside, Quarles, Hoop Spur, Westover and Wycamp. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for eastern Arkansas...and northwestern Mississippi. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
